intro: Antholyza fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed antholyza, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a serrated or fringed edge, contributing to its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
